question1.question: The marketing manager at Universal Containers wants to view Twitter social data on the Account record. However, when they compare one of their Account records with other marketing managers, the Twitter data is missing. What can the App Builder recommend?
question1.option1text: Social is no longer enabled in the organization.
question1.option1textexplanation: Incorrect. Since the colleague could see the social data, then Social is still enabled for the organization. In order to see social data on their records, the user needs to first link a personal social account and then log in.
question1.option2text: The marketing manager needs to link a personal social account.
question1.option2textexplanation: Correct. In order to see social data, the user needs to link personal social account and log in.
question1.option3text: Twitter is not supported in Social Accounts.
question1.option3textexplanation: Incorrect. Twitter is supported in Social Accounts. In order to see social data, the user needs to link personal social account and log in.
question1.option4text: The marketing manager does not have permission to access the Accounts object on their profile.
question1.option4textexplanation: Incorrect. The marketing manager can see the Account record, but just not see the social data. In order to see social data, the user needs to link personal social account and log in.
